body.p:
1467–8
AC Furnival's Inn Accounts in a History of Lincoln's Inn MT Lib: LOFT MS 97
f 85

Pro Cirtheratore, duringe Christmas tyme for Musick (blank) 5
Pro cordis pro Cirtheris vj d.
...
Pro Pane pur les Revellors iiij d.
Not any reward mentioned, for Musick, whereby it appereth, they had yt
gratis, or of theire owne without chardge/

f 85 (Christmas charges)
. . .
Pro Cordis Cirthere iiij d.

1416–17
AC Furnival's Inn Accounts in a History of Lincoln's Inn MT Lib: LOFT MS 97
f 86 (Christmas expenses)
. . .
fforreyn Expences touchinge the Revells
Pro Sema Pomorum xiij d.

1430–1
Lincolns Inn Black Book 1 LI Arch: A1a1
f 20* (Pensioner's accounts)
[Be hit in mynde that in the ffest off seynt arkenewold the ixthe yer off kyng
Henry the vjth it is accorded by all the felawschip that ther schal be iiij revels
in the yeere and no mo that is to sayyng in the fest off [seint Hugh], all
[hak] Halowen] oon to the wych schall be contributorie as well tho persons
[the] wych were woned to paye to sent William ys revell as tho the wych
were woned paie to [the same], seynt Hugh is Revell and in the fest off

seint arkenwold another to wych schall be contributorie sent Edmond is
men. Item the iijde in the fest off Purificacion off owre lady to wych all the
remenaunt schall be contributorie savyng seint Peter & seint Thomas men.
the fferthe on Midsomer day to wych sall be contributorie seynt Peter &
seint Thomas men. [all so it is accorded that aswell they ben absent as they
that be present] Item that hit be lawefulle to the collectours of euery revel to
make leve of euery person is dwete to the same revel & of hir maynprenours
is goodis with yn the said felavshippe

AC Furnival's Inn Accounts in a History of Lincoln's Inn MT Lib: LOFT MS 97

f 78 (Pensioner's accounts)
. . .
⁌ Item deliuered to Eland & Stathum to be vse of pe ffeliship for
Christenmas Anno xxviij Regis Henrici vj liij s. viij d.
⁌ Item wherof paied to pe Mynstrals [pro] for Cristenmas Anno xxviij. Regis
Henrici vj per Manus Stathum xl s....
. . .
c 1450
Sir [ohn Fortescue, Prenobilis Militis src: 11153
f 61v
In his reuera hospiciis maioribus, etiam et minoribus vltra studium legum,
est quasi gimnasium omnium morum qui nobiles decent. Ibi cantare ipsi
addiscunt, similiter et se excercent in omni genere harmonie. Ibi etiam
tripudiare ac iocos singulos nobilibus conuenientes, qualiter in domo regia
exercere solent enutriti, in ferialibus diebus eorum pars maior legalis discipline
studio, et in festiualibus sacre scripture, & cronicorum lectioni, post diuina
obsequia se confert.
1450–1
Lincoln's Inn Black Book 1 LI Arch: A1a1

Henrici vjti xxix xl s....
5/ Vnde: ie, from the sum total of receipts
10, 11, 40/ Inde: ie, from the sum total of receipts

AC Furnival's Inn Accounts in a History of Lincoln's Inn MT Lib: LOFT MS 97
f 87
. . .
The fare in Venison, and other Cheare for the whole Christmas tyme,
contynueth in like forme, and fasshion, as in formour yeres, with litle, or
noe alteration at all. Heare was Revells and is related.
In regardo Fidiceni Domini IOHANNIS TALBoTT militis viij d.
Tresawell exoneratur De Officio Senescalli in Septimana Natalis Domini./
Eo quod Stanley, Garnon & Moresby renuerunt accipere super
se Officium REGIs tempore Natalis Domini, ante impetrationem
Brevis De Supersedias quilibet amercietur in vj S. Ad.
. . .

In Annis 6, 8 & D Edward 4, nothinge appeareth worthie of Relation, ffor

1466–7
Lincoln's Inn Black Book 1 LI Arch: A1a1
f 148
. . .
⁌ Thomas Ienney Magister Revellorum
. . .
f 149*
. . .
Memorandum Trinitatis vijo Edwardi iiijti accidit quod quedam facta ad
5/ Magister Revellorum: underlined

arma partita inter antonium Wydevile dominum de scales ex vna parte &
Bastardum filium ducis Burgundie: ex altera parte in [campo] quodam loco
vocato smythseld essent facienda: super quo dominus Rex mandauit iiijor
hospicijs Curie: quod quodlibet hospicium iuberet iiij homines [.] eiusdem
hospicij armatos ad attendendum super dictum dominum Regem in predicto
loco tempore faciendi dicta facta quod mandatum improuide fuit consensum
ex ijbus hospicijs templi contra voluntatem & consensum [.] nostram: set
postea: per omnia consensum: Et ista societas electauit iiij socios: viz. Willelmum
Debenham Robertum Debenham Iohannem Gygges & Iohannem loyce bene
armatos &c & Insuper [an] conduxerunt in Grosso quoddam Skeffald [.]
pro ludendis factis &c. pro quo soluerunt: CS. & pro dictis armatis: &
[(...)] suorum expensis xl s.: super quo consensum fuit per eandem societatem:
quod quilibet socius presens in villa soluet ij s. & quilibet absens xij d.
1467–8
Lincolns Inn Black Book 1 LI Arch: A1a1
f 152v*
. . .
⁌ Memorandum quod [Gubernatori] Iohannes appland Willelmus hudesfeld &
Robertus Gascoigne respondent de & pro seruientibus suis pro collectione de
et pro eis pur lez Skaffaldes qu(.) (. . .) adhuc inde computauerunt viz.
Michaelis viijo Edwardi iiijti
f 153* (Treasurer's receipts)
...
⁌ Idem respondet de V li. XVS. receptis de auditoribus compoti quorumdam
collectorum denariorum pro lez Skaffeldes &c. hoc anno.
. . .
⁌ Nota quod vij li. & XS. parcelle dicte x li. & iiij d. soluti erant circa
dicta Skaffalda
⁌ Et sic nota quod solucio pro & circa dicta Skeffalda excedet summam
collectam pro eodem xxxv S. adhuc: quiquidem xxxv S. soluti erant extra
Thesaurium & sic detrimentum socijs adhuc
Et nota quod dicte summe arreragia Pensionarij & Thesaurarij que in toto
attigerunt ad xij li. xiiij S. Vd. solute erant super compotum predictum: per
preceptum Rogeri Tounesend diliberate erant incontinenti: prefato Ricardo
Whitley tam Thesaurario quam Pensionario pro anno sequenti per dicti
Rogeri Tounesend assignatos Ac compotus predictus & diuersi alij Rotuli
& compoti ad tunc diliberati erant prefato Ricardo Whiteley: inter quos
erat Rotulus pro collectione dictorum receptorum pro le Skaffald &c
7/ nostram: for nostrum

f 154 (Treasurer's allowances)
⁌ Item vj s. viij d. pro Mariscallo hospicij pro tempore Natalis domini
⁌ Item xx soluti histrionibus pro dicto tempore

AC Furnival's Inn Accounts in a History of Lincoln's Inn MT Lib: LOFT MS 97
f 88* (Christmas charges)
. . .
In Anno II Edwardi 4. the Christmas tooke its begynnynge heare at
Alhalontide, as it dothe at this daie, It seemith not it was before that tyme in
vse, ffor that formorly no mention is thereof at all in theire Bookes made,
and it is here mentioned for a great ffestivall. by the perticulers of dyett.
. . .
In reward to the Harpur
xx d.
In regardo Cirtheratori
viij d.
Revells is mentioned, henceforth to attend
euerie Saturdaie weekelie, vsque festum
Purificacionis, and mynstralsy & Revelling
held in Christmas tyme sicut ab antiquo.

Private Memorandum in a Lincoln's Inn Statute Book LI Lib: MS Misc. 2
ff ii–ii verso*
Memorandum yat on sonday ye iijde day of Ianyuer Anno quinto Henrici vij &
Anno domini 1480 ye disgysyng of ye Inner Temple went to grays Inne after ye
gyse affore tymes vsed. And on sonday nexte after ye disgysyng of grays Inne
cam in lyke wise to ye Inner temple And on satturday penultimo die Ianuary
proximo sequenti yer supped in ye forseyd Temple which cam thyder for to see
ye disgysing. Therle of Oxford Therle of Derby Therle of Schrousbery lord
Hastynges & lorde chamberlane] & xvi or xvij other knyghtes besides squyeres
& gentylmen &c
. . .

extraordinarie

Sherard
. . .
⁌ Memorandum quod in ffesto Natalis domini anno predicto fuit magna
pestilencia & pro eo consideratum fuit per societatem quod omnes socij
[tunc] qui tunc tenebantur custodire vacaciones suas. essent perdonati de
illa vacacione &c Ita quod custodirent aliam vacacionem pro illa &c
⁌ Et quod Mariscallus Magister Revellorum & pincerna suprascripti electi pro
eodem festo & anno sequenti sibi modo exonerarentur pro tunc. Ita quod
6/ purificacionibus: for purificacionis

occuparent officia sua predicta in proximo ffesto Natalis domini & anno
extunc sequenti

c 1500
Legal Report of Sir [ohn Spelman on Gray's Inn BL: Hargrave MS 388
ff 122–2v*
. . .
lez rulez en auncient temps vse en graies Inne
en temps del natiuite nostre sariour Ihesu christi.
Apres lez prescripcions vn est elect roy par lez clerkz del 3ce table et seera en
le middes del haut banke et esliera officerz quex fueront deuaunt ordeignez
par le fellowshipe al coperde et adonques lez gardenz del cere prendront lez
torches et le copberour et le carver doneront paine et service al roy et adonques
le roy soy leuera et toutz clameront vna voce viva le roy et en le iour de
cristmas le roy serra serue par toutz cez officerz et apres le seconde course le
ympne serra chaunte et maintenant sur ceo le harrode vindra al roy a faire son
proposicion et son responz serra fait par le counsell del seniorz et puis le roy
lauerer cez mainz estoiant sur cez peez et toutz cez seniorz doient approcher al
roy et le husher gisera le towell sur le auncient senior que est la except le
41/ lauerer: for lauera

chauncelour et il basera le towell et deliuera lun fine al roy mez deuaunt ceo
le dean dira grace oue le antheme nescienz mater chaunte et donques toutz
dirront viua le roy et adonques le marishall irra al revells et deuaunt lez revelz
sont finishe irra de faire luy prest a aler al esglise et deliuera a chescun gentil
home deinz le Inne vn conusanz de argent et adonques le marishall irra
deuaunt son test discouer et lez pluis puisnez pluiz prochin a luy et lez pluiz
auncienta le] pluis darren chauntant al esglise what shall we singe in worshipe
of this daie &c. et al esglise le marishal trouera vn caroll par que il paiera xl d.
et apres vespers il reuertera al Inne ouesque vn chaunte appelle ther shall none
reigne downe reigne &c. et issint rounde abowt the fier plus hastiuement
que deuaunt ouesque vn showt al fine et apres al soper le roy serra serue come
deuaunt et apres le soper le revellz at apres le court de constable et le reer soper
et puis la antheme et adonques al cardz et dice et lez denerz pur le marshall
et issint chescun iour par toutz lez xii iourz serra fait come deuaunt except
que le roy ne seera si non lez iourz festiualz ne solempne revelz ne serra garde
si non en lez iourz festiualz et en le fest de Epiphanie apres soper et revelz le
marisha/ et le stewarde vindront solempment al fier ouesque torche light
chauntant fare well et have good daye quex apres ij foitz chaunte aleront hors
le soile toutz foitz chauntant iesque ilz ont finishe lour songe et en le mene
temps le marishal et steward debruseront lour staffes et rodes et eux arderont
et puis le case serra assigne et nient skanne et puis le constable tiendra sa
court et maintenant sur le oiez toutz prendront le constable et a luy doneront
multz strips ouesque le tresorer fauorablement et adonques le reer soper
antyme et cardes et dice sanz marshal pence et nota quod le court de marshal
et steward serra tenuz le vigile de Epiphanye./
.. .

f 91v*
. . .
Lez lustes & Turnamentes fuervnt En le Palaice al Westminster coram Rege,
Regina, & Domina Margareta filia Regis. This Ladie was aboute this tyme
contracted in Matrymony Regi Scotiae. Per diuersos legatos Regis Scotiae, and
theis Embassadors, were then there present.

(Christmas charges)
kitchin chardges exceedinge, with Musick (.), and Revells
...
At Candlemas feast this yere, Musick, Capons, hennes, wyne, and so great a
supplie of venison, that they had so muche unexpended, yat to preserve the
same sweete diuers peices were, by the Cook commyted to the powderinge to
be preservid7
